prompt_templates.title: Basic poster creation
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants a simple research poster
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an HTML research poster about [TOPIC] with title, authors, introduction, methods, results, and conclusions sections. Generate AI visuals for each section first.

prompt_templates.title: Conference-specific poster
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs poster for specific conference
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 36Ã—48 inch HTML poster for [CONFERENCE_NAME] about [RESEARCH_TOPIC]. Follow the conference guidelines and include university logo space.

prompt_templates.title: Data-heavy poster

prompt_templates.title: PPTX export required

output: Generated 5 AI visuals: hero banner, workflow diagram, methods schematic, results chart, conclusions summary

best_practices: Generate ALL visuals before creating HTML - target 60-70% visual content
Use poster format specifications in EVERY AI visual prompt (giant text, 50% whitespace)
Preview at 25% zoom to ensure readability from 6 feet away
Limit to 300-800 words total text across all sections
anti_patterns: Creating complex 7+ stage workflows - simplify to 3-4 mega-steps maximum
Using small text in generated visuals - always specify 80pt+ font sizes
Adding too many sections - maximum 5-6 sections to prevent overflow
Skipping visual generation - always create AI visuals before HTML assembly

faq.question: When should I use this skill instead of latex-posters?
faq.answer: Only use pptx-posters when user explicitly requests PowerPoint/PPTX format. For all other poster requests, use latex-posters as the default.

faq.question: Why are my generated visuals unreadable?
faq.answer: You forgot poster format requirements. Always include 'POSTER FORMAT' with specifications for giant text (80pt+), 50% whitespace, and maximum 3-4 elements.

faq.question: How do I export to PowerPoint?
faq.answer: First export HTML to PDF via browser print, then convert using LibreOffice: 'libreoffice --headless --convert-to pptx poster.pdf'

faq.question: What if content is cut off at edges?
faq.answer: You have too much content. Reduce to maximum 5 sections and 800 words total. Check browser preview before exporting.

faq.question: Can I edit the poster after creation?
faq.answer: Yes, edit the HTML file directly for quick changes. For major changes, regenerate visuals first then update HTML.

faq.question: What image resolution should I use?
faq.answer: Generate visuals at 300+ DPI for print quality. The HTML template scales images appropriately for the 36Ã—48 inch format.
